result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Marie Charlotte Weymouth Sisson

defendant.name: Sisson, Nicole Marie Charlotte Weymouth

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:37 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Melstrom, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Nicole Marie Charlotte Sisson in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Nicole Marie Charlotte Sisson. INCLUDES 22CF526, 22CM475 and 22TR2029.Atty. Dolfi states that an offer has been received, requests additional time to consider. Court sets PSC. Adjourned: 9:39 AM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Includes 22CF526 and 22CM475.

$250 bond on file.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J.L.N.A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:49 PM CO: TCH for RMW, RPR: Melstrom, Clerk: Lindabaur ADA:  Michael Becker with Intern Connor Smith  DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi for today Defendant Nicole Marie Charlotte Sisson appeared by video, in custody. Includes 22CF526, 22CM475, and 22TR2029. DE does qualify for PD. DE confirms address. Waive reading. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Speedy prelim demanded. Court sets PH/STC.
